page.title: 04Glenthorne,Erdington.(1)
page.content: This Youth Treatment Centre is provided by the Department of Health and Social Security for the long-term care, control,treatment and education of persons aged between 12 and 18,who are severely disturbed and disruptive.47 people are accommodated,one-third of whom are Home Office referred under Section 53 of the Children and Young Persons Act,1933 either to a determinate period of detention,or to life for the commission of a grave crime (eg.murder,arson,manslaughter, rape etc). The accommodation consists of 3 basic units within a secure perimeter fence, and a fourth fully 'open' unit and hostel which lie outside.A gymnasium, swimming pool,administration offices, classrooms,library,dining room and kitchen are in the main block.
